channel.title: Viral Deadly Bacteria In Germany - We're all gonna dieeeeeeeeeeeee
channel.description:
[font=verdana][size=13px]UPDATE: On hlb.be (Belgium's biggest news paper company) we received an update to the situation. As it says on the site, appareantly the Spanish cumcumbers we're not the reason. Yes there was ecoli in the cumcumbers but from a different family (harmeless family). So it says that the source of the bacteria is unindetified at the moment. It says on the site that some health minister told us to not eat tomatoes, cumcumbers and cabbage to make sure we don't get infected.
Here's the source, use google translate or so to read.
I have this idea that maybe the east could have gotten something to do with this. Biological attack?
Also, let's see if Germany will refund the damage they caused for the Spanish market.
[url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/962/Gezondheid/article/detail/1272509/2011/05/31/Spaanse-komkommer-niet-oorzaak-van-EHEC-bacterie.dhtml]http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/962/Gezondheid/article/detail/1272509/2011/05/31/Spaanse-komkommer-niet-oorzaak-van-EHEC-bacterie.dhtml[/url][/size][/font]
P.S. 14 people died and new reports of sick people came in this weekend.
I live next to Germany NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
I've wanted to post this 3 days ago but I thought this probably will end soon.
[b]But apparantly the situation is getting much much more worse and already 10 people died of this bacteria.[/b] [b]More than 1000 people are infected in 8 countries. [/b] [b]There is atm no cure for this bacteria.[/b]
A lot of infected people are unable to [b]see/talk[/b]. Germany cannot control this epidemic bacteria. Germany is running out of blood for transfusions. Labs in different countries are working on a new experimental medicine that should protect your kidneys called Eculizumab.
[b]The symptoms of this bacteria are as following:[/b]
[b]EHEC broke a few weeks ago and quickly spread across Germany. The bacteria canintestinal bleeding, severe diarrhea, nausea, fever, abdominal cramps, anemia and renal failure. Another problem is that the German bacterium aggressive than usual and resistant to many common antibiotics appears.[/b]
(I used [b]google translate[/b] since I'm to [b]lazy[/b] to translate it myself.)
These are the links that got me informed:
[url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/2659/Voedselcrisis/article/detail/1271013/2011/05/27/Duitse-tuinders-krijgen-verse-groenten-moeilijk-verkocht.dhtml]http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/2659/Voedselcrisis/article/detail/1271013/2011/05/27/Duitse-tuinders-krijgen-verse-groenten-moeilijk-verkocht.dhtml[/url]
[url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/960/Buitenland/article/detail/1271168/2011/05/28/Darmbacterie-Duitsland-blijft-levens-eisen.dhtml]http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/960/Buitenland/article/detail/1271168/2011/05/28/Darmbacterie-Duitsland-blijft-levens-eisen.dhtml[/url]
[url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/960/Buitenland/article/detail/1271380/2011/05/29/Meer-dan-1-000-besmettingen-met-EHEC-bacterie-in-8-landen.dhtml]http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/960/Buitenland/article/detail/1271380/2011/05/29/Meer-dan-1-000-besmettingen-met-EHEC-bacterie-in-8-landen.dhtml[/url]
[url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/962/Gezondheid/article/detail/1271635/2011/05/29/Duitsland-krijgt-horrorbacterie-niet-onder-controle.dhtml]http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/962/Gezondheid/article/detail/1271635/2011/05/29/Duitsland-krijgt-horrorbacterie-niet-onder-controle.dhtml[/url]
[b]Here is a video for them english people:[/b]
[b][url=http://www.euronews.net/2011/05/29/more-die-in-german-ecoli-scare/]http://www.euronews.net/2011/05/29/more-die-in-german-ecoli-scare/[/url][/b]
[size=3.95em][b]DISCUSS:[/b][/size]

item.title: Viral Deadly Bacteria In Germany - We're all gonna dieeeeeeeeeeeee
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:55, topic:396991”]10 people? Holy shit. That’s like…

[size=3.95em]0.000000014%
OF THE HUMAN POPULATION![/size]
We’re fucked!

By the way, there’s a difference between a virus and bacteria.
Stop being an idiot.[/quote]I know there is, I said like once viral bacteria but I reffered to outbreaking bacteria. That’s my fault.

However, UPDATE: On hlb.be (Belgium’s biggest news paper company) we received an update to the situation. As it says on the site, appareantly the Spanish cumcumbers we’re not the reason. Yes there was ecoli in the cumcumbers but from a different family (harmeless family). So it says that the source of the bacteria is unindetified at the moment. It says on the site that some health minister told us to not eat tomatoes, cumcumbers and cabbage to make sure we don’t get infected.

Here’s the source, use google translate or so to read.

I have this idea that maybe the east could have gotten something to do with this. Biological attack?

Also, let’s see if Germany will refund the damage they caused for the Spanish market.

http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/962/Gezondheid/article/detail/1272509/2011/05/31/Spaanse-komkommer-niet-oorzaak-van-EHEC-bacterie.dhtml

P.S. 14 people died and new reports of sick people came in this weekend.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:50, topic:396991”][quote author=Tom_BETA link=topic=494150.msg3613552#msg3613552 date=1306795707]
It’ll probably just be like swine flu, if it’s not, then oh well.

edit: I’ve just looked around a bit, and news stations actually don’t seem to be reporting this as a huge headline.
[/quote]

Yeah, won’t be nearly as hyped up as swine flu. It’s just some ecoli infected cucumbers. Likely happened in some packaging facility or something(I didnt read). This happens quite often really, products are recalled for ecoli, listeria, etc. Unfortunately some people died which makes this case more serious.[/quote]good point, I hear the lawsuit bells ^^

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:47, topic:396991”]Are your comparisons supposed to scare people? Zombies? Black death? I don’t understand how 10 people dieing reflects the black death (which killed 1/3 of europes population if I remember correctly). The media hype up situations because it’ll sell.

It’ll probably just be like swine flu, if it’s not, then oh well.

edit: I’ve just looked around a bit, and news stations actually don’t seem to be reporting this as a huge headline.[/quote]I made those to create some tention as in could this be something like…? It probably was not a good idea to do that.

Also, I’ve haven’t heard anything from it on the news today so I guess their having it under control?

Read full topic
